title: ojoThemes Guide
text: First, let’s see data looks default ggplot:  Next, let’s gussy ojoThemes tools. First, let’s use ojothemes::ojo_labs() function easily add nice caption plot:  just wrapper normal ggplot2::labs() function, can pass arguments like title, subtitle, x, y . really neat thing, though, new analyst_name source arguments. add nice little “Graphic created …” caption crediting analyst, consistently phrased note data came . Right now, can use "oscn", "ocdc", "ppb" source argument get pre-written, consistent source note. However, ’re working something one domains, can just tell something put verbatim, e.g. source = "Source: Data Pulled National Insitute Ass database". Next, let’s actually apply themes. two ways : first just throw + theme_okpi() onto ggplot, like :  applies just theme / fonts, color / fill scales well. want just theme without scales, can p1 + theme_okpi_base(). second way applying theme using ojothemes::ojo_set_theme(). probably going common way things, since ’re rarely going want use multiple themes script / document / etc. Let’s try graph “ojo” theme time:
code: p1 <- data |>   # We'll look at the bookings by race here,   # and we'll look by month just to make it easier to see.   count(     book_month = floor_date(book_date, "months"),     race   ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = book_month, y = n, fill = race)) +   geom_col()  p1 p1 <- p1 +   ojo_labs(     analyst_name = "Andrew Bell",     source = "ocdc",     title = "OCDC Bookings by Race",     subtitle = "January 2024 - October 2024",     x = "Month",     y = "Total Booking Events"   )  p1 p1 + theme_okpi() ojo_set_theme(theme = "ojo")  p1

title: ojoThemes Guide
text: package also built themes tables made gt. can use replacing normal gt() function one themed wrappers (currently gt_okpi() gt_ojo()). built arguments customization: source analyst_name (work just like ojo_labs() function ggplots) title subtitle (self explanatory) format_cols (logical apply auto-styling gt every column TRUE) font font_size making really big / small tables. ’s normal, unstyled table looks like… …’s gt_okpi() theme … …finally, ’s gt_ojo():
code: data |>   count(race) |>   gt() data |>   count(race) |>   gt_okpi(     title = "OCDC Bookings by Race",     subtitle = "January 2024 - October 2024",     source = "ocdc",     analyst_name = "Andrew Bell",     format_cols = TRUE   ) data |>   count(race) |>   gt_ojo(     title = "OCDC Bookings by Race",     subtitle = "January 2024 - October 2024",     source = "ocdc",     analyst_name = "Andrew Bell",     format_cols = TRUE   )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Bell. Maintainer, author. Anthony Flores. Author. Brancen Gregory. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bell , Flores , Gregory B (2025). ojothemes: OJO, OKPI, TOK themes ggplot2 gt. R package version 1.1.2, https://openjusticeok.github.io/ojothemes/.

what: OJO, OKPI, and TOK themes for ggplot2 and gt
title: OJO, OKPI, and TOK themes for ggplot2 and gt
text: package contains OK Policy branded themes ggplot2 plots gt tables. currently three different looks available: "okpi" default OK Policy branding, "ojo" defunct Open Justice Oklahoma branding, "tok" Together Oklahoma theme.

title: OJO, OKPI, and TOK themes for ggplot2 and gt

text: near-exact copy default ggplot2 GeomCol ggproto object. difference adjusted make default column width smaller. ensures looks right matter scale data using.

text: object class GeomCol (inherits GeomRect, Geom, ggproto, gg) length 4.

title: geom_col in the Open Justice Oklahoma style — geom_col
code: geom_col(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "stack",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: geom_col in the Open Justice Oklahoma style — geom_col
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame., used layer data. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like color = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders.

what: Use Oklahoma Policy Institute ggplot2 themes — ojo_set_theme
title: Use Oklahoma Policy Institute ggplot2 themes — ojo_set_theme
text: ojo_set_theme provides ggplot2 theme formatted according Oklahoma Policy Institute style guide, sensible defaults.

title: Use Oklahoma Policy Institute ggplot2 themes — ojo_set_theme
code: ojo_set_theme(   theme = "okpi",   base_size = 18,   base_line_size = 0.5,   base_rect_size = 0.5,   scale = "continuous" )

title: Use Oklahoma Policy Institute ggplot2 themes — ojo_set_theme
text: theme theme wish use. Options "okpi", "ojo", "tok". base_size base font size theme. fonts relative value. base_line_size base line size theme. line sizes relative value. base_rect_size base rect size theme. rect sizes relative value. scale theme_ojo_map(). legend theme continuous discrete?

title: OJO Color Scale — scale_color_ojo
text: function returns ggplot2 color scale using OJO main palette.

title: OJO Color Scale — scale_color_ojo
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: OJO Color Scale — scale_color_ojo
code: library(ggplot2) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘ggplot2’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:ojothemes’: #>  #>     geom_bar, geom_col, geom_jitter, geom_line, geom_path, geom_point, #>     geom_step, geom_text ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(gear))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_ojo()

title: OKPI Color Scale — scale_color_okpi
text: function returns ggplot2 color scale using OKPI main palette.

title: OKPI Color Scale — scale_color_okpi
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: OKPI Color Scale — scale_color_okpi
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(gear))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_okpi()

title: TOK Color Scale — scale_color_tok
text: function returns ggplot2 color scale using TOK main palette.

title: TOK Color Scale — scale_color_tok
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: TOK Color Scale — scale_color_tok
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(gear))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_tok()

title: OJO Fill Scale — scale_fill_ojo
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(gear), fill = factor(gear))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_ojo()

title: OKPI Fill Scale — scale_fill_okpi

title: TOK Fill Scale — scale_fill_tok

what: A ggplot2 theme formatted in the Oklahoma Policy Institute style — theme_ojo
title: A ggplot2 theme formatted in the Oklahoma Policy Institute style — theme_ojo
text: theme_okpi provides ggplot2 theme formatted according Oklahoma Policy Institute style guide web, sensible defaults, also inclusdes OKPI fill color scales.

title: A ggplot2 theme formatted in the Oklahoma Policy Institute style — theme_ojo
code: theme_ojo(   base_size = 14,   base_family = "Roboto Mono",   base_line_size = 0.5,   base_rect_size = 0.5 )

title: A ggplot2 theme formatted in the Oklahoma Policy Institute style — theme_ojo
text: base_size base font size use; 14 default. base_family font family use; Roboto Condensed default. base_line_size base line size use; 0.5 default. base_rect_size base rect size use; 0.5 default.
